title: Particle motion - Average value of velocity

content.question: A particle moves along the x-axis. The velocity of the particle at time t is given by <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>v</mi> <mrow> <mo>(</mo> <mi>t</mi> <mo>)</mo> </mrow> <mo>,</mo> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3D67@</annotation> </semantics> </math> and the acceleration of the particle at time t is given by <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>a</mi> <mrow> <mo>(</mo> <mi>t</mi> <mo>)</mo> </mrow> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3CA2@</annotation> </semantics> </math>. Which of the following gives the average velocity of the particle from time <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>t</mi> <mo>=</mo> <mn>0</mn> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaWG0bGaeyypa0JaaGimaaaa@3BB4@</annotation> </semantics> </math> to time <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>t</mi> <mo>=</mo> <mn>8</mn> <mo>?</mo> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaWG0bGaeyypa0JaaGioaiaac+daaaa@3C7F@</annotation> </semantics> </math>

topic.text: 8.1: Finding the Average Value of a Function on an Interval

skill.text: Skill 1.E: Apply appropriate mathematical rules or procedures, with and without technology.
